dice.desc:
This bot can roll dice using dice notation, which originates from tabletop games. The seven standard tabletop dice have 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 20, and 100 sides; they are notated *d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, and d100*. When rolling a die more than once, the number of rolls is written in front of the "d", e.g. *2d6*. Omnimancer can also roll non-standard dice (e.g. d3, d7), many of which can't exist in real life. You can add or subtract a number with *+* or *-* for (de)buffs, as in *d12+3* or *d8-5*.

*Exploding dice* is a mechanic some games use, in which rolling the highest number allows you to add an extra roll to your total, marked with *!* after the number of die sides. For example, if you roll *2d6!*, it's possible to get something like __6 + 5__ + 2 = 13 or even 4 + __6 + 6 + 6 + 1__ = 23.

For games that use them, this bot also supports *FUDGE* or *FATE* dice, which are six-sided dice with 2 blank faces, 2 faces with + signs, and 2 faces with - signs each. You can use these with **?roll dF**.

Omnimancer can roll up to 999-sided dice 99 times in one command.
dice.sugg:
- Use several 8-sided die to generate a melody
- Use a 12-sided die to pick one of 12 musical keys
- Check tabletop game manuals for die-based events that can inspire writing
dice.comm:
**?roll d20** *roll a twenty-sided die once*
**?roll 5d6** *roll a six-sided die five times*
**?roll NdX** *roll an X-sided die N times*
**?roll d%** *alternative way of writing d100*
**?roll dR** *roll a random standard die*
**?roll dF** *roll FUDGE/FATE dice*
**?roll 4d4+2** *roll 4d4, then add 2 to the total*
**?roll 3d6!** *roll 3d6 exploding*
**?roll [...] me** *privately roll, good for GMs*

oblique.desc: This bot can draw a card from Oblique Strategies, a set of creative prompts written by musician Brian Eno and artist Peter Schmidt. Oblique Strategies inspired the creation of this bot.
oblique.comm:
**?oblique** *draw a card for everyone*
**?oblique me** *draw a card for yourself*

image.desc: This bot can post a picture from Dogpile Image Search, using a randomly picked search term from a list of all things (kinda) gothic.
image.sugg: What if there were something just off-camera?
image.comm:
**?image** *post a random image*
**?image me** *send yourself a random image*

tarot.desc: This bot can draw a random Rider-Waite Tarot card, upright or reversed, with a link to a tarot.com page about that card. With the "more" option, the card it draws will include Arthur Waite's original description from The Pictorial Guide to the Tarot, even though it's pretty archaic.
tarot.sugg:
- Be the Querent, but in character
- Tarot symbolism has inspired tons of character and plot design
tarot.comm:
**?tarot** *draw a card for everyone to see*
**?tarot more** *include Waite's reading*
**?tarot verbose** *include Waite's reading*
**?tarot me** *draw a card for yourself*

reddit.desc: This bot can fetch random Reddit posts from a selection of subreddits that focus on creative prompts.
reddit.sugg: Many of the prompts are focused on short stories, but they also work for lyrics.
reddit.comm:
**?reddit** *post a random Reddit prompt*
**?reddit me** *send yourself a random Reddit prompt*

trope.desc: This bot can fetch a link to a random entry in TV Tropes' List of Gothic Horror Tropes.
trope.sugg: Whether you play these tropes straight or subvert them into submission is up to you.
trope.comm:
**?trope** *post a random TV Trope*
**?trope me** *send yourself a random trope*

help.desc:
Writer's or artist's block getting you down? **Omnimancer** is an bot which posts many types of **random prompts** to inspire creative people. Built with Gothy Discord in mind, it can flip coins, roll dice, search for random images, draw Oblique Strategies and Tarot cards, and fetch content from Reddit and TV Tropes--all with a roughly Gothic theme.

You can tell the bot to give you one of these options specifically (see "Commands"), or it can pick one for you with the ?random command. The bot usually posts results to #bot-room, but if you want your result to be private, you can type **me** at the end of your command.

Like many of the card decks it's based on, Omnimancer rewards **lateral thinking** and creative interpretation. The helpfiles come with suggestions to interpret prompts whose meaning isn't immediately obvious.
help.comm:
**?roll**, **?dice** *roll tabletop dice*
**?flip**, **?coin** *flip coins*
**?oblique** *draw an Oblique Strategies card*
**?image** *random online image search...no worries, it's SFW*
**?tarot** *draw a Tarot card and look up its meaning*
**?reddit** *writing/art prompt from Reddit*
**?trope** *draw from the List of Gothic Horror Tropes*
**?random** *the bot picks a prompt for you*
**?[...] me** *send results to yourself as a DM*
help.help:
**?help** *this helpfile*
**?help [...]** *helpfile for a specific type of prompt*
Prompt types include **dice, coin, oblique, image, tarot, reddit, trope, random**
help.exam:
**?oblique** *draw an Oblique Strategies card*
**?help reddit** *get help with Reddit module*
**?roll d20** *roll a 20-sided die*

coin.desc: This bot can flip coins. You can use **?flip** or **?coin**.
coin.sugg: - Flip 16 coins to make a random 4/4 rhythm with just heads or tails
coin.comm:
**?flip**, **?coin** *flip a coin for all to see*
**?flip 6** *flip six coins*
**?flip 10 me** *flip 10 coins that only you can see*
